Summary: Four star-like dots, flying in V formation, last seen as one of them dropped straight down like a shooting star
trends: There have been 31 other sightings in Roseville
There were no other sightings in Roseville on or around July 10th 2011
divs: sighting detailswas in my pool, looking at the sky for satellites and noticed the object(s). four star-like dots flying in v formation east to west in the northern sky. were very close together, moving too fast for an airplane (appeared to be much higher than a plane would be anyway) and too fast for satellites. i only saw it for 4, maybe 5 seconds. as it disappeared, i saw what i first thought was a shooting star going straight down from where the object was, almost a 90 degree angle from the direction the objects were going. my attention shifted to that single object as it fell and then disappeared behind the neighbors house. when it did, i tried to find the other objects and they were gone. after thinking about it, i realized that there was no trail on the shooting star, just a bright dot of light falling. the first four objects weren't very bright, maybe "medium brightness star-like". the object that fell downward was much brighter, more "planet-like". at first thought i believed i was looking at an owl (bright moon out tonight and i thought it was simply reflecting on a bird). but after a second i realized it wasn't a bird and that's when i realized it was much higher than a plane would be, almost like they were in orbit. i stayed in the pool another 10 minutes to see the objects would appear again. after that, i really got nervous\scared over what i had seen and went inside. it's 2:00am and i'm wide awake. i don't think i'm going to get much sleep tonight. i've always hoped to see something like this, but now that i have, i'm a little freaked out.
